solution_line_template: They ordered {num_dozen_oysters} dozen oysters at ${cost_per_dozen_oysters} a dozen so that's {num_dozen_oysters}*{cost_per_dozen_oysters} = $<<{num_dozen_oysters}*{cost_per_dozen_oysters}={cost_oysters}>>{cost_oysters}

They ordered {pounds_shrimp} pounds of steamed shrimp for ${cost_per_pound_shrimp} a pound so that's {pounds_shrimp}*{cost_per_pound_shrimp} = $<<{pounds_shrimp}*{cost_per_pound_shrimp}={cost_shrimp}>>{cost_shrimp}

They ordered {pounds_clams} pounds of fried clams for ${cost_per_pound_clams} a pound so that's {pounds_clams}*{cost_per_pound_clams} = $<<{pounds_clams}*{cost_per_pound_clams}={cost_clams}>>{cost_clams}
All total their bill comes to {cost_oysters}+{cost_shrimp}+{cost_clams} = $<<{cost_oysters}+{cost_shrimp}+{cost_clams}={total_bill}>>{total_bill}

Their bill was ${total_bill} and they are splitting it equally amongst {num_people} people so they each owe {total_bill}/{num_people} = $<<{total_bill}/{num_people}={cost_per_person}>>{cost_per_person}
